who.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used to ask or talk about which person is involved, or what the name of a person is
who.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Who’s that guy with your wife?
They never found out who the murderer was.
She wondered who had sent the flowers.
Who on earth would live in such a lonely place?
who on earth/in the world etc
who on earth/in the world etc
He doesn’t know who to vote for.
who.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used after a noun to show which person or which people you are talking about
who.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Do you know the people who live over the road?
She was the one who did most of the talking.
who.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used, after a comma in writing, to add more information about a particular person or group of people that you have just mentioned
who.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I discussed it with my brother, who is a lawyer.
Alison Jones and her husband David, who live in Hartlepool, are celebrating their golden wedding anniversary.
who.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: used to introduce a question that shows you think something is true of everyone or of no one
who.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: We have the occasional argument. Who doesn’t (=everyone does)?
Who wants to come second (=no one does)?
who.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a British rock group whose members included Roger Daltrey, the group's main singer, and Pete Townshend. They first became popular in the mid-1960s and are known especially for their song My Generation and for their  album Tommy. They sometimes used to end their performances by violently destroying their instruments.
